activities: Websense receives personal data from the EU regarding its employees for human resources related purposes and services.  Websense receives personal data from the EU regarding its customers in order to complete a transaction, to manage customer records and administer on-line accounts, to communicate back to the customer, to provide product and service updates, to provide customer support, to deliver marketing information, to improve its products and services, to administer and improve its website, and to carry out research and data analytics, in each case to the extent permitted by applicable law.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: Websense agrees to cooperate with the EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) solely with respect to human resources-related personal data complaints, and utilize the American Arbitration Association (AAA) for all other unresolved personal data complaints.
